ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This course provides students with the tools to design sociological research projects. Yes.
Yes, I would recommend this course.
This is a class I would recommend to any social science grad student, even outside of sociology. Many history students would also benefit from the class.
I would recommend this class to other students, especially to those who are in their 1st or 2nd year.

I would certainly recommend this course, it helps to understand principles of social research in detail. The time and effort invested here into understanding a phenomenon such as an "alternative explanation" is worth it, I think it marks the difference between a certain "language" of social science and a serious understanding of the working process and criteria behind it. It develops up a range of criteria to comment on the quality of qualitative and quantitative work alike.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Yes, it deepened my knowledge of the discipline. It definitely contributedto my research and will do so for a long time.
It deepened my knowledge of sociological methodology and helped me begin thinking about how to design my second-year research paper.
This provided me with a much-needed methodology to ask the right questions and go about answering them. A must.
It would be very helpful to my future research.
It is a very helpful course enabling a grad student to think more broadly and critically both his/her own future research and the others'.

This course helped me to prepare for my dissertation reserach in many ways: in identifying topics relevant to the social sciences, in gaining a sense of how professional discussions in American sociology work and most of all, in understanding and working with the criteria and professional standards to improve one's research.
